item.title: The problem with Intel's SEC filings and NLP
item.description: The Problem with Intel’s SEC filings and Natural Language Processing Objective The aim of this article was to show how chipmaker Intel Corporation makes use of their own 10-K form which differs substantially from the SEC 10-K, making automation of document reading much more difficult for analysts. Methodology The main method used in this article is visual presentation and discussion. Results In its latest 10-K SEC filing, Intel Corporation states as follows:

item.title: Ether price vs Ethereum Gas price - more utility in the Ethereum network?
item.description: Comparison of Ether and Ethereum Gas prices Objective The aim of this article was to compare the prices of Ether and Ethereum Gas. Additionally an attempt was made at answering a question of whether Ethereum network is gaining more utility. Methodology The main method used in this article is visual presentation and discussion. A program was written using python and jupyter lab environment to collect the relevant data and project it onto a graph.

item.title: Using NLP and SEC filings to explore hitech companies
item.description: Analysis of hitech companies Introduction Recently a survey was conducted among participants of investing channel on reddit. The original poster asked redditors to name technologies and companies worth investing in, for future growth and profits. Responses among reddit users are usually open ended and vague, however several technologies were named, such as: biotechnology and genome sequencing, microchip production, micro nuclear reactors, solid state batteries, quantum computing and others. Also, several publicly traded companies were named and their trading ticker was provided.
